meanings.definition: Of very great excellence or beauty.
meanings.sent1: The sunset was the sublimest sight I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting was truly sublimest, capturing the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so sublimest that it seemed almost too perfect to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was the sublimest melody, enchanting all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The sublimest flower in the garden stood out with its vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: His sublimest ideas inspired others to dream big.
meanings.sent2: The poet's words were filled with sublimest emotions, touching the hearts of many.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sublimest plan to catch the mouse involved a clever disguise.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the sublimest mountain represented the challenges she had overcome.
meanings.sent5: The sublimest dream she had was to travel the world and help those in need.

meanings.definition: The highest or most supreme level.
meanings.sent1: Reaching the sublimest peak of the mountain was a challenging but rewarding journey.
meanings.sent2: In the hierarchy of needs, self-actualization is considered the sublimest level.
meanings.sent3: The competition aimed to find the sublimest talent in the city.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft led him to the sublimest heights of success.
meanings.sent5: The sublimest point of the story was when the hero saved the day.
